<description type="note">Title: The compact of the soldiers and Pilate.
Genre: English mystery and miracle plays.
[The Compact of the Soldiers and Pilate]

Tunc evigilabunt milites sepulcri et dicit primus miles ius miles Awake Awake hillis gyn qwake And tres ben shake ful nere a-too Stonys clevyd wyttys ben revid Erys ben devid I am servid soo. 2us miles he is a-resyn Ã¾is is no nay Ã¾at was deed and colde in clay now is resyn be-lyve Ã¾is day grett woundyr it is to me He is resyn by his owyn myght And fforth he goth his wey ful ryght how xul we now us qwytte Whan Pylat doth us se. 3us miles lete us now go pilat on-too And ryght evyn so as we han sayn Ã¾e trewth we sey Ã¾at out of clay he is resyn Ã¾is day Ã¾at jewys han slayn. 4us miles I holde it best lete us nevyr rest but go we prest Ã¾at it were done All heyl pilatt in Ã¾in A-stat he is resyn up latt Ã¾at Ã¾ou gast dome. Pilat What What What What Out upon the why seyst Ã¾ou Ã¾at Ffy vpon the harlat how darst Ã¾ou so say Ã¾ou dost myn herte ryght grett greff Ã¾ou lyest vpon hym fals theff howe xulde he rysyn ageyn to lyff Ã¾at lay deed in clay 1us miles ?a Ã¾ow Ã¾ou be nevyr so wroth And of these tydandys nevyr so loth ?itt goodly on ground on lyve he goth qwycke and levynge man Iff Ã¾ou haddyst a ben Ã¾er we ware in hert Ã¾ou xuldyst han had gret care And of blysse a ben ryght bare Of colore bothe pale and whan. Pilatus Or ?e com there ?e dede all swere to fyght in fere and bete and bynde All Ã¾is was trayn ?our wurdys wore vayn Ã¾is is sertayn ?ow fals I fynde. 2us miles Be Ã¾e deth Ã¾e devyl deyd we were of hym so sore Atreyd Ã¾at ffor ffer we us down leyd Ryght evyn vpon oure syde whan we were leyd upon Ã¾e grounde stylle we lay as we had be bounde we durst not ryse for a thowsand pounde ne not for all Ã¾is worlde so wyde. Pilatus Now ffy upon ?our grett bost all ?our wurchep is now lost in felde in town and in every cost men may ?ou dyspravyn now all ?our wurchep it is lorn And euery man may ?ow we scorn And bydde ?ow go syttyn in Ã¾e corn And chare a-wey Ã¾e ravyn 3us miles ?a it was hy? tyme to leyn oure bost Ffor whan Ã¾e body toke a?en Ã¾e gost he wold a frayd many An ost kynge knyght and knave ?a whan he dede ryse out of his lake Ã¾an was Ã¾er suche An erthe-quake Ã¾at all Ã¾e worlde it gan to shake Ã¾at made us ffor to rave. 4us miles ?a ?a herke ffelawys what I xal say late us not ses be nyght nor day but telle Ã¾e trewth ryght as it lay In countre where we goo And than I dare ley myn heed Ã¾at Ã¾ei Ã¾at crystys lawys leed they wyl nevyr ses tyl they be deed his deth Ã¾at brought hym too. ius miles Be belyall Ã¾is was now wele ment to Ã¾is cowncell lete us consent lett us go tellyn with on Assent he is resyn up Ã¾is day. 2us miles I grawnt Ã¾er-to and Ã¾at forth ryght Ã¾at he is resyn by his owyn myght Ffor Ã¾er cam non be day nor nyght to helpe hym owte of clay. Pilatus Now jentyl serys I pray ?ow All A-byde stylle a lytyl thrall whyll Ã¾at I myn cowncel call And here of Ã¾er councell. ius miles Syr att ?our prayour we wyl abyde here in Ã¾is place a lytel tyde but tary not to longe ffor we must ryde we may not longe dwelle. Pilatus Now jentyl serys I pray ?ow here Sum good cowncel me to lere Ffor sertys serys without dwere We stounde in right grett dowte. Cayphas Now trewly sere I ?ow telle Ã¾is matere is both ffers and felle combros it is Ã¾erwith to melle And evyl to be browth a-bowte. Annas Syr pylat Ã¾ou grett justyse Ã¾ow Ã¾ou be of wittys wyse ?it herke fful sadly with good devyse what Ã¾at Ã¾ou xalt do I counsel Ã¾e be my reed Ã¾is wundyrful tale pray hem to hede and upon Ã¾is ?eve hem good mede bothe golde and sylver also. And sere I xall telle ?ow why in ?oure erys prevyly be-tweyn us thre serteynly now herk serys in ?our erys. his faciant pilatus cayphas et Annas priuatim inter se consilium quo finito dicat Annas Ffor mede doth most in every qwest and mede is mayster bothe est and west now trewly serys I hold Ã¾is best With mede men may bynde berys Cayphas Sekyr sere Ã¾is counsell is good pray Ã¾ese knyhtys to chaunge Ã¾er mood ?eve them golde ffeste and ffood And Ã¾at may chaunge Ã¾er wytt. Pylatt Serys ?oure good councel I xall fulfylle now jentyl knyhtys come hedyr me tylle I pray ?ow serys of ?our good wylle no ferther Ã¾at ?e fflytt. Jentyl knyhtys I ?ow pray A bettyr sawe Ã¾at ?e say Sey Ã¾er he was cawth away with his dyscyplis be nyght Sey he was with his dyscyplis ffett I wolde ?e worn in ?oure sadelys ssett And haue here gold in a purs knett and to rome rydyth ryght. 4us miles Now syr pylatt we gon oure gatt We wyll not prate no lengere now now we haue golde no talys xul be tolde to whithtys on wolde we make Ã¾e A vow. Pilatus Now ?e men of myth as ?e han hyght Euyn so forth ryght ?oure wurdys not falle And ?e xul gon with me A-non All every-chon in to myn halle. 1us miles Now hens we go As lyth as ro And ryght evyn so As we han seyd We xul kepe counsel where so evyr we dwell We xul no talys tell be not dysmayd.
